venue.name: Lucy Robbins Welles Library - Community Room

item.description: Since the 1980s when near-death experiences became part of public consciousness, they have held endless attraction for people.  Join Dr. Matthew Raider, MD, to hear the latest medical research and discover a simple, natural way to connect with the inner light talked about by those who've experienced a NDE.  Dr. Raider draws parallels between near-death experiences and those had by people who meditated throughout the ages.  Dr. Raider is a clinical physician and coordinating director of the Geriatric Teaching Program in Family Medicine at Middlesex Hospital in Connecticut. He has been practicing meditation for over 30 years. No registration is required.This event is sponsored by the library.
item.name: Beyond Death: Medical Facts, Mysticism and Meditation
